info.title: Microsoft Graph Security
info.description: The Microsoft Graph Security connector helps to connect different Microsoft and partner security products and services, using a unified schema, to streamline security operations, and improve threat protection, detection, and response capabilities. Learn more about integrating with the Microsoft Graph Security API at https://aka.ms/graphsecuritydocs

get.description: Get a list of security alerts for this Azure Active Directory tenant. Use with different query parameters.

@odata.nextLink.title: Next link
@odata.nextLink.description: A link to get the next results in case there are more results than requested

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify filtering condition for alerts like Severity eq "High".

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specify the recent most top number of alerts to retrieve from each provider.

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Specify alert properties to include in the results.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specify sorting order for the results.

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Specify number of results to skip. Useful for pagination.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Specify to include the number of alerts returned in the response

get.description: Get a security alert corresponding to the specified ID.

patch.description: Update specific properties of a security alert.

assignedTo.description: Specify the name of the analyst the alert is assigned to for triage, investigation, or remediation.
assignedTo.title: Assigned to

closedDateTime.description: Specify the time at which the alert was closed. The Timestamp type represents date and time information using ISO 8601 format and is always in UTC time.
closedDateTime.title: Closed dateTime

items.description: Specify comments on alert for customer alert management.
items.title: Comments

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: Specify any user-definable labels that can be applied to an alert and can serve as filter conditions (for example "HVA", "SAW", etc.).

feedback.description: Specify analyst feedback on the alert.
feedback.title: Feedback

status.description: Specify status to track alert lifecycle status (stage).
status.title: Status

provider.description: Specific provider (product/service - not vendor company); for example, WindowsDefenderATP.
provider.title: Provider name

providerVersion.description: Specify version of the provider or subprovider, if it exists, that generated the alert.
providerVersion.title: Provider version

subProvider.description: Specific subprovider (under aggregating provider); for example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen.
subProvider.title: Sub Provider name

vendor.description: Specify name of the alert vendor (for example, Microsoft, Dell, FireEye).
vendor.title: Vendor name

get.description: Get the list of unexpired subscriptions for this Azure Active Directory tenant.

@odata.nextLink.title: Next link
@odata.nextLink.description: A link to get the next results in case there are more results than requested

resource.description: Specify the resource that will be monitored for changes. Do not include base URL (https://graph.microsoft.com/v1.0/). Include security/alerts followed by the odata query. For e.g. security/alerts?$filter=status eq �New�
resource.title: Resource URL

changeType.description: Specify the property type that should raise a notification when changed on the subscribed resource.
changeType.title: Change type

clientState.description: Specify the client state to confirm the notification origination source.
clientState.title: Client state

notificationUrl.description: Specify a well-formed URL of the endpoint that will receive notifications.
notificationUrl.title: Notification URL

expirationDateTime.description: Specify the date time when the webhook subscription expires; needs to be a date time greater than current time and within 30 days.
expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time

delete.description: Delete the specific Microsoft Graph Webhook subscription.

parameters.name: Subscription Id
parameters.description: Specify the Microsoft Graph Webhook Subscription ID.

patch.description: Renew a Microsoft Graph webhook subscription by updating its expiration time.

parameters.name: Subscription Id
parameters.description: Specify Microsoft Graph Webhook subscription ID.

expirationDateTime.description: Specify the date and time, in UTC format, of when the Microsoft Graph webhook subscription expires. The maximum expiration time for security alerts is 43200 minutes (under 30 days).
expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time

@odata.nextLink.title: Next link
@odata.nextLink.description: A link to get the next results in case there are more results than requested

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: Create new alerts to trigger the flow

get.description: Triggers on new high severity alerts

@odata.nextLink.title: Next link
@odata.nextLink.description: A link to get the next results in case there are more results than requested

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: Create high severity alerts to trigger the flow

@odata.nextLink.title: Next link
@odata.nextLink.description: A link to get the next results in case there are more results than requested

get.description: Get a list of threat intelligence indicators for this Azure Active Directory tenant. Use with different query parameters.

parameters.name: $filter
parameters.description: Specify filtering condition for threat intelligence indicators like threatType eq 'WatchList'

parameters.name: $top
parameters.description: Specify the recent top number of threat intelligence indicators to be retrieved

parameters.name: $select
parameters.description: Specify threat intelligence indicator properties to include in the results.

parameters.name: $count
parameters.description: Specify to include the number of threat intelligence indicators returned in the response

parameters.name: $skip
parameters.description: Specify number of results to skip. Useful for pagination.

parameters.name: $orderby
parameters.description: Specify sorting order for the results.

post.description: Create a new threat intelligence indicator by posting to the tiIndicators collection.

action.title: Action
action.description: The action to apply if the indicator is matched from within the targetProduct security tool. Values: (unknown, allow, block, alert).

activityGroupNames.title: Activity group names
activityGroupNames.description: The cyber threat intelligence name(s) for the parties responsible for the malicious activity covered by the threat indicator.

additionalInformation.title: Additional information
additionalInformation.description: Extra data from the indicator not covered by the other tiIndicator properties may be placed

azureTenantId.title: Azure Tenant ID
azureTenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant id of submitting client.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Confidence of the detection logic (percentage between 0-100).

diamondModel.title: Diamond model
diamondModel.description: The area of the Diamond Model in which this indicator exists. Values: (unknown, adversary, capability, infrastructure, victim).

expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time
expirationDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator expires (UTC).

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: An identification number that ties the indicator back to the indicator provider’s system (e.g. a foreign key).

ingestedDateTime.title: Ingested date time
ingestedDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator is ingested (UTC).

isActive.title: Is active
isActive.description: By default, any indicator submitted is set as active. However, providers may submit existing indicators with this set to ‘False’ to deactivate indicators in the system.

killChain.title: Kill chain
killChain.description: strings that describes which point or points on the Kill Chain this indicator targets. Values: (Actions, C2, Delivery, Exploitation, Installation, Reconnaissance, Weaponization).

knownFalsePositives.title: Known false positives
knownFalsePositives.description: Scenarios in which the indicator may cause false positives.

lastReportedDateTime.title: Last reported date time
lastReportedDateTime.description: The last time the indicator was seen (UTC).

malwareFamilyNames.title: Malware family names
malwareFamilyNames.description: The malware family name associated with an indicator if it exists.

passiveOnly.title: Passive Only
passiveOnly.description: Determines if the indicator should trigger an event that is visible to an end-user.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Severity of the malicious behavior identified by the data within the indicator. Values are from 0 – 5 with 5 being most severe. Default value is 3.

targetProduct.title: Target Product
targetProduct.description: Single security product to which the indicator should be applied. Acceptable values are: Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender ATP.

threatType.description: Each indicator must have a valid Indicator Threat Type. Possible values are: Botnet, C2, CryptoMining, Darknet, DDoS, MaliciousUrl, Malware, Phishing, Proxy, PUA, WatchList.
threatType.title: Threat Type

tlpLevel.description: Traffic Light Protocol value for the indicator. Possible values are: unknown, white, green, amber, red.
tlpLevel.title: Tlp level

emailEncoding.title: Email encoding
emailEncoding.description: The type of text encoding used in the email.

emailXMailer.title: Email XMailer
emailXMailer.description: X-Mailer value used in the email.

fileCompileDateTime.title: File compile date time
fileCompileDateTime.description: DateTime when the file was compiled.

fileCreatedDateTime.title: File created date time
fileCreatedDateTime.description: DateTime when the file was created.

fileHashType.title: File hash type
fileHashType.description: The type of hash stored in fileHashValue. Possible values are: unknown, sha1, sha256, md5, authenticodeHash256, lsHash, ctph.

fileMutexName.title: File mutex name
fileMutexName.description: Mutex name used in file-based detections.

fileName.title: File name
fileName.description: Name of the file if the indicator is file-based.

filePacker.title: File packer
filePacker.description: The packer used to build the file in question.

filePath.title: File path
filePath.description: Path of file indicating compromise. May be a Windows or *nix style path.

fileSize.title: File size
fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

fileType.title: File type
fileType.description: Text description of the type of file. For example, “Word Document” or “Binary”.

domainName.title: Domain name
domainName.description: Domain name associated with this indicator.

networkCidrBlock.title: Network cidr block
networkCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the network referenced in this indicator.

networkDestinationAsn.title: Network destination Asn
networkDestinationAsn.description: The destination autonomous system identifier of the network referenced in the indicator.

networkDestinationCidrBlock.title: Network destination cidr block
networkDestinationCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the destination network in this indicator.

networkProtocol.title: Network protocol
networkProtocol.description: Decimal representation of the protocol field in the IPv4 header.

networkSourceAsn.title: Network source Asn
networkSourceAsn.description: The source autonomous system identifier of the network referenced in the indicator.

networkSourceCidrBlock.title: Network source cidr block
networkSourceCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the source network in this indicator.

userAgent.title: User agent
userAgent.description: User-Agent string from a web request that could indicate compromise.

get.description: Get a threat intelligence indicator corresponding to the specified ID.

delete.description: Delete a threat intelligence indicator corresponding to the specified ID.

patch.description: Update specific properties of a threat intelligence indicator. Required fields for the tiIndicator are: Id, expirationDateTime, and targetProduct.

action.title: Action
action.description: The action to apply if the indicator is matched from within the targetProduct security tool. Values: (unknown, allow, block, alert).

activityGroupNames.title: Activity group names
activityGroupNames.description: The cyber threat intelligence name(s) for the parties responsible for the malicious activity covered by the threat indicator.

additionalInformation.title: Additional information
additionalInformation.description: Extra data from the indicator not covered by the other tiIndicator properties may be placed

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Confidence of the detection logic (percentage between 0-100).

diamondModel.title: Diamond model
diamondModel.description: The area of the Diamond Model in which this indicator exists. Values: (unknown, adversary, capability, infrastructure, victim).

expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time
expirationDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator expires (UTC format. For example, 2020-03-01T00:00:00Z).

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: An identification number that ties the indicator back to the indicator provider’s system (e.g. a foreign key).

isActive.title: Is active
isActive.description: By default, any indicator submitted is set as active. However, providers may submit existing indicators with this set to ‘False’ to deactivate indicators in the system.

killChain.title: Kill chain
killChain.description: strings that describes which point or points on the Kill Chain this indicator targets. Values: (Actions, C2, Delivery, Exploitation, Installation, Reconnaissance, Weaponization).

knownFalsePositives.title: Known false positives
knownFalsePositives.description: Scenarios in which the indicator may cause false positives.

lastReportedDateTime.title: Last reported date time
lastReportedDateTime.description: The last time the indicator was seen (UTC).

malwareFamilyNames.title: Malware family names
malwareFamilyNames.description: The malware family name associated with an indicator if it exists.

passiveOnly.title: Passive Only
passiveOnly.description: Determines if the indicator should trigger an event that is visible to an end-user.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Severity of the malicious behavior identified by the data within the indicator. Values are from 0 – 5 with 5 being most severe. Default value is 3.

tlpLevel.description: Traffic Light Protocol value for the indicator. Possible values are: unknown, white, green, amber, red.
tlpLevel.title: Tlp level

targetProduct.title: Target Product
targetProduct.description: Single security product to which the indicator should be applied. Acceptable values are: Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender ATP.

post.description: Create new threat intelligence indicators by posting a tiIndicators collection. Required fields for each tiIndicator are: action, azureTenantId, description, expirationDateTime, targetProduct, threatType, tlpLevel.

networkSourceAsn.description: The source autonomous system identifier of the network referenced in the indicator.

networkSourceCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the source network in this indicator.

userAgent.description: User-Agent string from a web request that could indicate compromise.

action.description: The action to apply if the indicator is matched from within the targetProduct security tool. Values: (unknown, allow, block, alert).

activityGroupNames.title: Activity group names
activityGroupNames.description: The cyber threat intelligence name(s) for the parties responsible for the malicious activity covered by the threat indicator.

additionalInformation.title: Additional information
additionalInformation.description: Extra data from the indicator not covered by the other tiIndicator properties may be placed

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Confidence of the detection logic (percentage between 0-100).

diamondModel.title: Diamond model
diamondModel.description: The area of the Diamond Model in which this indicator exists. Values: (unknown, adversary, capability, infrastructure, victim).

expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time
expirationDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator expires (UTC).

targetProduct.title: Target Product
targetProduct.description: Single security product to which the indicator should be applied. Acceptable values are: Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender ATP.

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: An identification number that ties the indicator back to the indicator provider’s system (e.g. a foreign key).

isActive.title: Is active
isActive.description: By default, any indicator submitted is set as active. However, providers may submit existing indicators with this set to ‘False’ to deactivate indicators in the system.

killChain.description: strings that describes which point or points on the Kill Chain this indicator targets. Values: (Actions, C2, Delivery, Exploitation, Installation, Reconnaissance, Weaponization).

lastReportedDateTime.description: The last time the indicator was seen (UTC).

malwareFamilyNames.description: The malware family name associated with an indicator if it exists.

passiveOnly.title: Passive Only
passiveOnly.description: Determines if the indicator should trigger an event that is visible to an end-user.

severity.description: Severity of the malicious behavior identified by the data within the indicator. Values are from 0 – 5 with 5 being most severe. Default value is 3.

tlpLevel.description: Traffic Light Protocol value for the indicator. Possible values are: unknown, white, green, amber, red.
tlpLevel.title: Tlp level

post.description: Delete multiple threat intelligence indicators corresponding to the specified IDs.

post.summary: Delete multiple tiIndicators by external IDs
post.description: Delete multiple threat intelligence indicators corresponding to the specified external IDs.

azureSubscriptionId.title: Azure subscription ID
azureSubscriptionId.description: Azure subscription ID, present if this alert is related to an Azure resource.

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: User-definable labels that can be applied to an alert and can serve as filter conditions (e.g. "HVA", "SAW", etc.).

activityGroupName.title: Activity group name
activityGroupName.description: Name or alias of the activity group (attacker) this alert is attributed to.

assignedTo.title: Assigned to
assignedTo.description: Name of the analyst the alert is assigned to for triage, investigation, or remediation.

category.title: Category
category.description: Category of the alert (e.g. credentialTheft, ransomware, etc.).

closedDateTime.title: Closed date time
closedDateTime.description: Time at which the alert was closed (UTC).

comments.title: Comments
comments.description: Customer-provided comments on alert (for customer alert management).

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Confidence of the detection logic (percentage between 1-100).

createdDateTime.title: Created date time
createdDateTime.description: Time at which the alert was created (UTC).

detectionIds.title: Detection Ids
detectionIds.description: Set of alerts related to this alert entity.

eventDateTime.title: Event date time
eventDateTime.description: Time at which the event(s) that served as the trigger(s) to generate the alert occurred (UTC).

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.description: Analyst feedback on the alert. Possible values are: unknown, truePositive, falsePositive, benignPositive.

lastModifiedDateTime.title: Last modified date time
lastModifiedDateTime.description: Time at which the alert entity was last modified (UTC).

recommendedActions.title: Recommended actions
recommendedActions.description: Vendor/Provider recommended action/s to take as a result of the alert (e.g. isolate machine, enforce2FA, reimage host, etc.).

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Alert severity - set by vendor/provider. Values: (high, medium, low, Informational) where "informational" infers that the alert is not actionable.

sourceMaterials.title: Source materials
sourceMaterials.description: Hyperlinks (URIs) to the source material related to the alert, e.g. provider investigation UI, etc.

status.title: Status
status.description: Alert lifecycle status (stage). Values: (unknown, newAlert, inProgress, resolved).

provider.title: Provider name
provider.description: Specific provider (product/service - not vendor company); for example, WindowsDefenderATP.

providerVersion.title: Provider version
providerVersion.description: Version of the provider or subprovider.

subProvider.title: Sub provider name
subProvider.description: Specific subprovider (under aggregating provider); for example, WindowsDefenderATP.SmartScreen.

vendor.title: Vendor name
vendor.description: Name of the alert vendor (for example, Microsoft, Dell, FireEye).

vendorInformation.title: Vendor Information
vendorInformation.description: Complex Type containing details about the Security product/service vendor, provider, and sub-provider.

items.title: Cloud app state
items.description: Complex type containing stateful information about the cloud application (destinationServiceName, destinationServiceIp).

destinationServiceIp.title: Destination service IP
destinationServiceIp.description: Destination IP address of the connection to cloud app/service.

riskScore.title: Risk score
riskScore.description: Provider-generated/calculated risk score of the Cloud Application/Service.

cloudAppStates.title: Cloud app states
cloudAppStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the cloud application/s related to this alert.

items.title: File state
items.description: Complex type containing information about the file (not process) related to the alert.

path.title: Path
path.description: Full file path of the file/imageFile.

riskScore.title: Risk score
riskScore.description: Provider generated/calculated risk score of the alert file.

fileHash.title: File hash
fileHash.description: Complex type containing file hashes (cryptographic and location-sensitive).

type.title: Type
type.description: File hash type. Possible values are: unknown, sha1, sha256, md5, authenticodeHash256, lsHash, ctph, peSha1, peSha256.

fileStates.title: File states
fileStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the file(s) related to this alert.

items.title: Host state
items.description: Complex type containing stateful information about the host (includes devices, machines, firewalls, etc.).

isAzureAdJoined.title: Is azureAd joined
isAzureAdJoined.description: True if the host is domain joined to Azure Active Directory Domain Services.

isAzureAdRegistered.title: Is azureAd registered
isAzureAdRegistered.description: True if the host registered with Azure Active Directory Device Registration (e.g. BYOD) - not fully managed by enterprise.

isHybridAzureDomainJoined.title: Is hybrid azure domain joined
isHybridAzureDomainJoined.description: True if the host is domain joined to an on-premises Active Directory domain.

netBiosName.title: Net bios name
netBiosName.description: Local host name without DNS domain name.

privateIpAddress.title: Private IP address
privateIpAddress.description: Private (not routable) IPv4 or IPv6 Address at the time of the alert.

publicIpAddress.title: Public IP address
publicIpAddress.description: Publicly routable IPv4 or IPv6 Address at time of the alert.

riskScore.title: Risk score
riskScore.description: Provider-generated/calculated risk score of the host.

hostStates.title: Host states
hostStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the host(s) related to this alert.

items.description: Contains stateful information about the malware entity.
items.title: Malware state

category.description: Provider-generated malware category (e.g. trojan, ransomware, etc.).
category.title: Category

wasRunning.description: Indicates whether the detected file (malware/vulnerability) was running at the time of detection or was detected at rest on the disk.
wasRunning.title: Was running

malwareStates.title: Malware states
malwareStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the malware related to this alert.

items.title: Network Connection
items.description: Complex type containing stateful information about the network connection related to the alert.

applicationName.title: Application name
applicationName.description: Name of the application managing the network connection (e.g. Facebook, SMTP, etc.).

destinationAddress.title: Destination address
destinationAddress.description: Destination IP address of the network connection.

destinationDomain.title: Destination domain
destinationDomain.description: Destination domain portion of the destination URL.(for example "www.contoso.com").

destinationPort.title: Destination port
destinationPort.description: Destination port of the network connection.

destinationUrl.title: Destination url
destinationUrl.description: Network connection URL/URI string - excluding parameters.

direction.title: Direction
direction.description: Network connection direction. Possible values are: unknown, inbound, outbound.

domainRegisteredDateTime.title: Domain registered dateTime
domainRegisteredDateTime.description: Date the destination domain was registered (UTC).

localDnsName.title: Local dns name
localDnsName.description: The local DNS name resolution as it appears in the host local DNS cache (e.g. in case the "hosts" file was tampered with).

natDestinationAddress.title: Nat destination address
natDestinationAddress.description: Network Address Translation destination IP address.

natSourceAddress.title: Nat source address
natSourceAddress.description: Network Address Translation source IP address.

protocol.title: Protocol
protocol.description: Network protocol. Possible values are: unknown, ip, icmp, igmp, ggp, ipv4, tcp, pup, udp, idp, ipv6, ipv6RoutingHeader, ipv6FragmentHeader, ipSecEncapsulatingSecurityPayload, ipSecAuthenticationHeader, icmpV6, ipv6NoNextHeader, ipv6DestinationOptions, nd, raw, ipx, spx, spxII.

riskScore.title: Risk score
riskScore.description: Provider generated/calculated risk score of the network connection.

sourceAddress.title: Source address
sourceAddress.description: Source (i.e. origin) IP address of the network connection.

sourcePort.title: Source port
sourcePort.description: Source (i.e. origin) IP port of the network connection.

status.title: Status
status.description: Network connection status. Possible values are: unknown, attempted, succeeded, blocked, failed.

urlParameters.title: Url parameters
urlParameters.description: Parameters (suffix) of the destination URL as a string.

networkConnections.title: Network connections
networkConnections.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the file(s) related to this alert.

items.title: Process
items.description: Complex Type containing stateful information about the process related to the alert.

accountName.title: Account name
accountName.description: User account identifier (user account context the process ran under) e.g. AccountName, SID, etc.

commandLine.title: Command line
commandLine.description: The full process invocation commandline including all parameters.

createdDateTime.title: Created date time
createdDateTime.description: DateTime at which the parent process was started (UTC).

integrityLevel.title: Integrity level
integrityLevel.description: The integrity level of the process. Possible values are: unknown, untrusted, low, medium, high, system.

isElevated.title: Is elevated
isElevated.description: True if the process is elevated.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the process Image file.

parentProcessCreatedDateTime.title: Parent process created date time
parentProcessCreatedDateTime.description: Time at which the process was started (UTC).

parentProcessId.title: Parent process ID
parentProcessId.description: The Process ID (PID) of the parent process.

parentProcessName.title: Parent process name
parentProcessName.description: The name of the image file of the parent process.

processId.title: Process Id
processId.description: The Process ID (PID) of the process.

fileHash.title: File hash
fileHash.description: Complex type containing file hashes (cryptographic and location-sensitive).

type.title: Type
type.description: File hash type. Possible values are: unknown, sha1, sha256, md5, authenticodeHash256, lsHash, ctph, peSha1, peSha256.

processes.title: Processes
processes.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the process or processes related to this alert.

items.title: Registry key state
items.description: Complex type containing information about registry key changes related to the alert, and the process that changed the registry keys.

process.title: Process
process.description: Process ID (PID) of the process that modified the registry key (process details will appear in the alert "processes" collection).

operation.title: Operation
operation.description: Operation that changed the registry key name and/or value (add, modify, delete).

valueType.title: Value Type
valueType.description: Registry key value type. Possible values are: unknown, binary, dword, dwordLittleEndian, dwordBigEndian, expandSz, link, multiSz, none, qword, qwordlittleEndian, sz.

hive.title: Registry hive
hive.description: Windows registry hive. Possible values are: unknown, currentConfig, currentUser, localMachineSam, localMachineSamSoftware, localMachineSystem, usersDefault.

valueName.title: Value name
valueName.description: Current (i.e. changed) registry key value name.

valueData.title: Value data
valueData.description: Current (i.e. changed) registry key value data (contents).

oldKey.title: Old key
oldKey.description: Previous (i.e. before changed) registry key (excludes HIVE).

oldValueName.title: Old value name
oldValueName.description: Previous (i.e. before changed) registry key value name.

oldValueData.title: Old value data
oldValueData.description: Previous (i.e. before changed) registry key value data (contents).

registryKeyStates.title: Registry key states
registryKeyStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the registry keys related to this alert.

items.title: Trigger
items.description: Contains information about the attribute that triggered a detection (properties exists in the alert entity).

name.title: Name
name.description: Name of the property serving as a detection trigger.

type.title: Type
type.description: Type of the attribute in the key:value pair for interpretation, e.g. String, Boolean, etc.

value.title: Value
value.description: Value of the attribute serving as a detection trigger.

triggers.title: Triggers
triggers.description: Security-related information about the specific properties that triggered the alert (properties appearing in the alert). Alerts might contain information about multiple users, hosts, files, ip addresses. This field indicates which properties triggered the alert generation.

items.title: User state
items.description: Contains stateful information about the user account.

aadUserId.title: AAD user ID
aadUserId.description: AAD User object identifier (GUID) - represents the physical/multi-account user entity.

accountName.title: Account name
accountName.description: Account name of user account (without Active Directory Domain or DNS Domain) - (also called "mailNickName").

domainName.title: Domain name
domainName.description: NetBIOS/Active Directory Domain of user account �(i.e. domain\account format).

emailRole.title: Email role
emailRole.description: For email-related alerts - user account email role.

isVpn.title: Is Vpn
isVpn.description: Indicates whether the user logged on through a VPN.

logonDateTime.title: Logon date time
logonDateTime.description: Time at which the logon occurred (UTC).

logonIp.title: Logon IP
logonIp.description: IP Address the logon request orginated from.

logonLocation.title: Logon location
logonLocation.description: Location (by IP address mapping) associated with a user sign-in event by this user.

logonType.title: Logon type
logonType.description: Method of user sign in. Possible values are: unknown, interactive, remoteInteractive, network, batch, service.

onPremisesSecurityIdentifier.title: On premises security identifier
onPremisesSecurityIdentifier.description: Active Directory (on-premises) Security Identifier (SID) of the user.

riskScore.title: Risk score
riskScore.description: Provider-generated/calculated risk score of the user account.

userAccountType.title: User account type
userAccountType.description: User account type (group membership), per Windows definition. Possible values are: unknown, standard, power, administrator.

userPrincipalName.title: User principal name
userPrincipalName.description: User sign-in name - internet format: <user account name>@<user account DNS domain name>.

userStates.title: User states
userStates.description: Security-related stateful information generated by the provider about the logged-on user or users related to this alert.

items.title: Vulnerability State
items.description: Contains stateful information about the vulnerability.

cve.title: Cve
cve.description: Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures (CVE) for the vulnerability.

wasRunning.title: Was running
wasRunning.description: Indicates whether the detected vulnerability (file) was running at the time of detection or was the file detected at rest on the disk.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Base Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) severity score for this vulnerability.

vulnerabilityStates.title: Vulnerability states
vulnerabilityStates.description: Threat intelligence pertaining to one or more vulnerabilities related to this alert.

resource.title: Resource
resource.description: Specifies the resource that will be monitored for changes.

applicationId.title: Application Id
applicationId.description: Identifier of the application used to create the subscription.

changeType.title: Change type
changeType.description: Indicates the type of change in the subscribed resource that will raise a notification.

clientState.title: Client state
clientState.description: Specifies the value of the clientState property sent by the service in each notification. The maximum length is 128 characters. The client can check that the notification came from the service by comparing the value of the clientState property sent with the subscription with the value of the clientState property received with each notification.

notificationUrl.title: Notification URL
notificationUrl.description: The URL of the endpoint that will receive the notifications. This URL must make use of the HTTPS protocol.

expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time
expirationDateTime.description: Specifies the date and time when the webhook subscription expires (UTC).

creatorId.title: Creator Id
creatorId.description: Identifier of the user or service principal that created the subscription. If the app used delegated permissions to create the subscription, this field contains the id of the signed-in user the app called on behalf of. If the app used application permissions, this field contains the id of the service principal corresponding to the app.

action.title: Action
action.description: The action to apply if the indicator is matched from within the targetProduct security tool. Values: (unknown, allow, block, alert).

activityGroupNames.title: Activity group names
activityGroupNames.description: The cyber threat intelligence name(s) for the parties responsible for the malicious activity covered by the threat indicator.

additionalInformation.title: Additional information
additionalInformation.description: Extra data from the indicator not covered by the other tiIndicator properties may be placed

azureTenantId.title: Azure Tenant ID
azureTenantId.description: The Azure Active Directory tenant id of submitting client.

confidence.title: Confidence
confidence.description: Confidence of the detection logic (percentage between 0-100).

diamondModel.title: Diamond model
diamondModel.description: The area of the Diamond Model in which this indicator exists. Values: (unknown, adversary, capability, infrastructure, victim).

expirationDateTime.title: Expiration date time
expirationDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator expires (UTC).

externalId.title: External ID
externalId.description: An identification number that ties the indicator back to the indicator provider’s system (e.g. a foreign key).

id.title: ID
id.description: Created by the system when the indicator is ingested. Generated GUID/unique identifier.

ingestedDateTime.title: Ingested date time
ingestedDateTime.description: Time at which the the Indicator is ingested (UTC).

isActive.title: Is active
isActive.description: By default, any indicator submitted is set as active. However, providers may submit existing indicators with this set to ‘False’ to deactivate indicators in the system.

killChain.title: Kill chain
killChain.description: strings that describes which point or points on the Kill Chain this indicator targets. Values: (Actions, C2, Delivery, Exploitation, Installation, Reconnaissance, Weaponization).

knownFalsePositives.title: Known false positives
knownFalsePositives.description: Scenarios in which the indicator may cause false positives.

lastReportedDateTime.title: Last reported date time
lastReportedDateTime.description: The last time the indicator was seen (UTC).

malwareFamilyNames.title: Malware family names
malwareFamilyNames.description: The malware family name associated with an indicator if it exists.

passiveOnly.title: Passive Only
passiveOnly.description: Determines if the indicator should trigger an event that is visible to an end-user.

severity.title: Severity
severity.description: Severity of the malicious behavior identified by the data within the indicator. Values are from 0 – 5 with 5 being most severe. Default value is 3.

targetProduct.title: Target Product
targetProduct.description: Single security product to which the indicator should be applied. Acceptable values are: Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender ATP.

threatType.description: Each indicator must have a valid Indicator Threat Type. Possible values are: Botnet, C2, CryptoMining, Darknet, DDoS, MaliciousUrl, Malware, Phishing, Proxy, PUA, WatchList.
threatType.title: Threat Type

tlpLevel.description: Traffic Light Protocol value for the indicator. Possible values are: unknown, white, green, amber, red.
tlpLevel.title: Tlp level

emailEncoding.title: Email encoding
emailEncoding.description: The type of text encoding used in the email.

emailXMailer.title: Email XMailer
emailXMailer.description: X-Mailer value used in the email.

fileCompileDateTime.title: File compile date time
fileCompileDateTime.description: DateTime when the file was compiled.

fileCreatedDateTime.title: File created date time
fileCreatedDateTime.description: DateTime when the file was created.

fileHashType.title: File hash type
fileHashType.description: The type of hash stored in fileHashValue. Possible values are: unknown, sha1, sha256, md5, authenticodeHash256, lsHash, ctph.

fileMutexName.title: File mutex name
fileMutexName.description: Mutex name used in file-based detections.

fileName.title: File name
fileName.description: Name of the file if the indicator is file-based.

filePacker.title: File packer
filePacker.description: The packer used to build the file in question.

filePath.title: File path
filePath.description: Path of file indicating compromise. May be a Windows or *nix style path.

fileSize.title: File size
fileSize.description: Size of the file in bytes.

fileType.title: File type
fileType.description: Text description of the type of file. For example, “Word Document” or “Binary”.

domainName.title: Domain name
domainName.description: Domain name associated with this indicator.

networkCidrBlock.title: Network cidr block
networkCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the network referenced in this indicator.

networkDestinationAsn.title: Network destination Asn
networkDestinationAsn.description: The destination autonomous system identifier of the network referenced in the indicator.

networkDestinationCidrBlock.title: Network destination cidr block
networkDestinationCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the destination network in this indicator.

networkProtocol.title: Network protocol
networkProtocol.description: Decimal representation of the protocol field in the IPv4 header.

networkSourceAsn.title: Network source Asn
networkSourceAsn.description: The source autonomous system identifier of the network referenced in the indicator.

networkSourceCidrBlock.title: Network source cidr block
networkSourceCidrBlock.description: CIDR Block notation representation of the source network in this indicator.

userAgent.title: User agent
userAgent.description: User-Agent string from a web request that could indicate compromise.
